justification: The Methods section notes that the study "used the Autism Spectrum Quotient (AQ10)" as part of its battery to assess "various aspects of mental health problems and neurodevelopmental conditions," indicating this questionnaire operationalises autistic traits.
Under "Questionnaire measures" the authors state they employed the "ADHD Self-Report Scale (ASRS)" to capture neurodevelopmental characteristics, showing ASRS was the instrument for ADHD symptoms.
The battery included the "Community Assessment of Psychic Experiences (CAPE)," indicating CAPE was used to measure psychosis-like or psychotic experiences.
The authors list the "Externalising Symptom Inventory Short Form (ESI-SF)" among their scales, demonstrating that externalising symptomatology was measured with the ESI-SF.
The Methods section specifies use of the "Personality Inventory for DSM-5 (PID-5)," indicating PID-5 served to assess personality pathology traits.
